content.description: Start up left edge of slick slab to tiered roof and on up.
content.location: Start up left edge of slick slab to tiered roof and on up.

content.description: Start on a steep arete, then move right and up to a technical face. Crux at the top.
content.location: On the left side as you enter the Crystal Corridor from the North side below Rob's Rock

content.description: This is the obvious wide crack to the left of Mr. Check-off.  There is some third class to gain the crack which goes from hands to OW.  The original line went way right to the Mr. Check-off anchor.  Nice if you want to TR that climb.
content.protection: Pro to 4.5 inches.  Doubles in hand/fist.  Optional 5 inch piece.
content.location: I have added a new anchor and a new route above Sulu.  Instead of going right to the Mr. Check-off anchor, continue up the crack to a belay at 90 feet.  Fat Bastard continues up from here.

content.description: Not sure how long this route has been here, just discovered it the other day. An easy start leads to great edge after great edge then clip the Mussys.

Listed as 5.8R in the guidebook, it actually has 4 bolts and though not as well protected as Blades of Glory, isn't very runout.  The crux comes around the second bolt.

A second pitch is registered as a project and will probably never be completed.  You can, however, climb the first four bolts of it and lower off if you want.
content.location: Left and uphill from Blades of Glory.  Climb the left crack to bolted face.

content.description:
4th class up to the first bolt, then head up the tricky face.  There is a distinct crux that might pose a challenge for shorter peeps.

Fun route.

Steep face to vertical face. Crux is getting feet established on vertical section. Very similar to Lat Machine and about the same difficulty.Â Marty has this line listed in his 2005 10th edition guide as a "1 bolt. Steep rotten roof." After removing a ton of loose rock, it is now merely a steep roof.
content.protection: 9 bolts to double steel biner lower off.
content.location: Located between Mr. Check-off and Twister. Starts on a low angle slab with a dirty wide crack. Scramble up the crack to the first bolt on the steep face.

climbs.name: Fat Bastard
climbs.fa: Eric Sorenson, Steve Gomez, Jody Martin.  04/2006

content.description: A beautiful, clean, lightning-bolt crack in the pink face up and left from the belay.  Bolted face climbing to the right of a bulge (crux) leads to a traverse left into the corner with the clean wide crack. Climb the wide crack either straight in or you can stem out left to a secondary crack.  The anchors are on the right wall on a small ledge.  Three stars out of five.
content.protection: Three bolts (crux at second) lead to the wide crack in the corner.  I usually carry 1 ea. 2"-5" cams plus quickdraws.
content.location: Located by climbing Sulu, but instead of going right to the Mr. Check-off anchor, continue up to the Fat Bastard belay.

content.description: Clip the first 3 bolts of Dellinger, then head right up a steep face.
Climb the arete, at the 6th bolt move right to Dust in the Wind.T

climbs.name: Clip Jockeys
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers and Marty Lewis, March 1991

content.description: A great off-vertical face climb with excellent movement.
Climb a short crack, then work up and right on face.
Located up and left of Clip Jockeys on a scree slope.  Climb the right of two cracks to a 5 bolt face.  At the 4th bolt, traverse right (crux) to the 5th bolt and finish with a final thin crack.
content.protection: 5 bolts and gear to 1.5" mostly small.  Mussy Hook anchor.
content.location: If Scalpel is the left crack, Blades of Glory is the right crack.
